Html:
Hi, I'm new here, I follow the tutorial instalation and I got all the dll, when I try to  build the tutorial 1 and 9  I got the  next

 The type or namespace name 'GoblinXNA' could not be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?) C:\GoblinXNAv3.5\tutorials\Tutorial9 - Advanced Features\Tutorial9.cs 12 7 Tutorial9 - Advanced Features

and more

 Warning 24 Could not resolve this reference. Could not locate the assembly "GoblinXNA, Version=3.9.30.2010, Culture=neutral, processorArchitecture=x86". Check to make sure the assembly exists on disk. If this reference is required by your code, you may get compilation errors. Tutorial1 - Getting Started

 

Do you have any idea what is going on?

 

Thanks a lot for your help

 

Hescobedoa

Right click on "GoblinXNA" in the "References" section, and click "Properties". Under properties window, set "Specific Version" to "False". I believe that should fix the problem. Otherwise, delete "GoblinXNA" from the references, and re-add it from the GoblinXNAv3.5/bin folder.

Ohan
Thanks for your help!! you were right!

hic.

I not found "GoblinXNA" from the GoblinXNAv3.6/bin folder, this folder in GoblinXNAv3.6 only have files: xnb, xsb, xwb, xgs

Help me...
did you build the solution? when you build it, if there are no errors, it should produce a GoblinXNA.dll in the bin directory.

what do you mean by build the solution?

if i use f6(which i think its the build), errors has occured such as rootname space blah blah blah..

 

when i delete the goblinxna, and readd it, i cannot find the goblinxna.dll in bin..

i cant generate goblinxna.dll...im using goblinxnav3.6

 

"

Right click on "GoblinXNA" in the "References" section, and click "Properties". Under properties window, set "Specific Version" to "False". I believe that should fix the problem. Otherwise, delete "GoblinXNA" from the references, and re-add it from the GoblinXNAv3.5/bin folder.

Ohan"

 

i already done that..but still its missing..

 

and also the rootnamespace error...help me im also newbie

im using VS2010, is  there any difference if i  use that?

 

and, if i build the solution, errors occured

In folder unmanaged, are you sure there dll files: alvar150.dll, alvarplatform150.dll, ALVARWrapper.dll, cv100.dll, cvaux100.dll, cvcam100.dll,  cxcore100.dll, highgui100.dll, Newton.dll ?

note: I compile ALVARWrapper1.5 project and it generated ALVARWrapper1.5.dll file , not ALVARWrapper.dll file, i rename it, then copy to unmanaged directory.

you try !
Oh, i using vs2008, if still erorr, you should try vs2008

there are no files in unmanaged folder...

 

how to compile so i can have alvarwrapper1.5dll? 

if i compile it, i can also have goblinxna.dll?
You should review Installation Guide.pdf in GoblinXNAv3.6\doc directory.

do you have ym/msn? can we talk there so you can help me?please...

im  planning to do an AR ball maze to my project which is to be submitted on friday..i dont know what should i do..:(

Hi,

my error is slightly different. when i added Scene class i will get error pointing at the Scene class variable saying

"The type 'Microsoft.XNA.Framework.DrawableGameComponent' is defined in an assembly that is not referenced. You must add a reference to assembly 'Microsoft.XNA.Framework.Game', version....token...."

I do a lot of things like remove and add all referenced libraries. tweaking the project properties settings & add the reference path but still the problem persists

please help

Hi,

my bad wasn't particular about the basic stuff. before, I compiled the tutorial with 2010 Express and XNA 4.0. Now everything works wonderfully. now I'm using 2008 Express & XNA 3.1
